Crush Grip.name: Crush Grip
Crush Grip.battle_effect: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move's power.
Crush Grip.secondary_effect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 110 making it a fairly powerful attack to be used. The means of determining the Base Power however is set based on the Opponent's Hit Points. The higher its hit points the better. This does not refer to the Base Stats for the Hit Points but rather the opponent's HP relative to its maximum at the current point in time.With this in mind, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attackBase Power = 110 * (Opponent's Current HP / Opponent's Max HP)So for example if we were battling a Max IV'd, Max EV'd Torterra at Level 100 and it had just over half its HP remaining, it would be as suchBase Power = 110 * (215 / 394) = 60.03 (2 d.p.)This shows that the best time to use Wring Out & Crush Grip would be at the start of a battle with any Pokémon, whether it has just been switched in or the battle is just beginning, in order to get the maximum Base Power. As the battle progresses, the power behind Wring Out & Crush Grip diminshes

Curse.name: Curse
Curse.battle_effect: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
Curse.secondary_effect: Ghost type Pokémon: User loses half their maximum HP, and the opponent gets a Nightmare. Other Pokémon types: Raises user's Attack and Defense one stage. Lowers user's Speed one stage.

Gyro Ball.name: Gyro Ball

Gyro Ball.secondary_effect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 150 making it a very powerful attack to be used. However, this is completely dependant on your Pokémon's Speed as well as the Speed of your target. First, the user & targets speeds are claculated. Their Speed Stat is taken into account as well as other effects such as previous attack effects that my have raised or lowered speed, whether the Pokémon is Paralyzed and whether or not it is holding an item that lowers Speed such as the Power Items used to train EVs or an Iron ball.With these statistics now calculated, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attackBase Power = 25 * (TargetSpeed / UserSpeed)With this equation, it is very easy to see that if the user has a considerably lower speed, due to being a slow Pokémon or just being unlucky and having had loads of attacks that have lowered speed used on it as well as being Paralyzed and holding an Iron Ball, it will do considerable damage. However, even if the Base Power calculation obtains an amount that is greater than 150, you will never have more than that.

This would give Punishment a boost of 40 in Base Power each time Calm Mind is used.Many movesets have people utilising this move or other moves such as this and then passing them on through Baton Pass, overall the power soon stacks up giving Punishment a massive boost.However, Punishment's Base Power is capped at 200.

Snipe Shot.name: Snipe Shot
Snipe Shot.battle_effect: The user ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's moves and Abilities that draw in moves, allowing this move to hit the chosen target.
Snipe Shot.secondary_effect: Ignores move redirection from abilities and moves

Snore.name: Snore
Snore.battle_effect: This attack can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
Snore.secondary_effect: Can only be used while asleep.

Soak.name: Soak
Soak.battle_effect: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target's type to Water.

Soft-Boiled.name: Soft-Boiled
Soft-Boiled.battle_effect: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.
Soft-Boiled.secondary_effect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

Solar Beam.name: Solar Beam
Solar Beam.battle_effect: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
Solar Beam.secondary_effect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

Solar Blade.name: Solar Blade
Solar Blade.battle_effect: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light's energy, attacking the target on the next turn.
Solar Blade.secondary_effect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

Sonic Boom.name: Sonic Boom
Sonic Boom.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike.name: Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike
Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Spacial Rend.name: Spacial Rend
Spacial Rend.battle_effect: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.
Spacial Rend.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Spark.name: Spark
Spark.battle_effect: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Sparkling Aria.name: Sparkling Aria
Sparkling Aria.battle_effect: The user bursts into song, emitting many bubbles. Any Pokémon suffering from a burn will be healed by the touch of these bubbles.

Sparkly Swirl.name: Sparkly Swirl
Sparkly Swirl.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Spectral Thief.name: Spectral Thief
Spectral Thief.battle_effect: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.
Spectral Thief.secondary_effect: This move will steal all the boosts in each of the opponent's stats from the target Pokémon before applying the damage. If the user has got an ability that alters stat gain such as Simple or Contrary, then those effects are applied to the gained stat boosts. It does not steal any stat drops from the opponent.

Speed Swap.name: Speed Swap
Speed Swap.battle_effect: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.

Spider Web.name: Spider Web
Spider Web.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Spike Cannon.name: Spike Cannon
Spike Cannon.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.
Spike Cannon.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Spikes.name: Spikes
Spikes.battle_effect: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team's feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.
Spikes.secondary_effect: Sets spikes that hurt the opponent upon switching.

Spiky Shield.name: Spiky Shield
Spiky Shield.battle_effect: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker that makes direct contact.
Spiky Shield.secondary_effect: Damages by 1/8th Maximum Hit Points if hit by physical contact.

Spirit Break.name: Spirit Break
Spirit Break.battle_effect: The user attacks the target with so much force that it could break the target's spirit. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
Spirit Break.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Sp. Atk one stage

Spirit Shackle.name: Spirit Shackle
Spirit Shackle.battle_effect: The user attacks while simultaneously stitching the target's shadow to the ground to prevent the target from escaping.

Spit Up.name: Spit Up
Spit Up.battle_effect: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move's power.
Spit Up.secondary_effect: This move has four tiers of damage; 3 are stockpiled, 1 isn't. Unfortunately the one that isn't is that the attack doesn't do anything if you haven't stockpiled so you have to make sure to Stockpile first.If you use Spit Up after 1 Stockpile, the Base Power will be 100If you use Spit Up after 2 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 200If you use Spit Up after 3 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 300

Spite.name: Spite
Spite.battle_effect: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.

Splash.name: Splash
Splash.battle_effect: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...

Splishy Splash.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Spore.name: Spore
Spore.battle_effect: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.

Spotlight.name: Spotlight
Spotlight.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Stealth Rock.name: Stealth Rock

Stealth Rock.secondary_effect: Sets rocks that hurt the opponent upon switching.

Steam Eruption.name: Steam Eruption

Steamroller.name: Steamroller
Steamroller.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Steel Roller.name: Steel Roller
Steel Roller.battle_effect: The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move fails when the ground hasn't turned into a terrain.

Steel Wing.name: Steel Wing
Steel Wing.battle_effect: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user's Defense stat.
Steel Wing.secondary_effect: May raise user's Defense one stage.

Sticky Web.name: Sticky Web
Sticky Web.battle_effect: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching into battle.
Sticky Web.secondary_effect: Sets a web that lower the opponent's Speed by one stage upon switching.

Stockpile.name: Stockpile
Stockpile.battle_effect: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used three times.
Stockpile.secondary_effect: User stockpiles power for up to 3 turns. Raises Defense & Special Defense one stage until Stockpile is released.

Stoked Sparksurfer.name: Stoked Sparksurfer
Stoked Sparksurfer.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

Stomp.name: Stomp
Stomp.battle_effect: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.

Stomping Tantrum.name: Stomping Tantrum
Stomping Tantrum.battle_effect: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user's previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.
Stomping Tantrum.secondary_effect: Doubles damage if last move failed

Stone Edge.name: Stone Edge
Stone Edge.battle_effect: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
Stone Edge.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Stored Power.name: Stored Power
Stored Power.battle_effect: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.
Stored Power.secondary_effect: This attack's power starts off with 20 Base Power but increases by 20 Base Power for each stat increase used by the Pokémon. Can get a maximum Base Power of 860. Moves with stat lowering effects do not affect this move's power.

Storm Throw.name: Storm Throw
Storm Throw.battle_effect: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.

Strange Steam.name: Strange Steam
Strange Steam.battle_effect: The user attacks the target by emitting steam. This may also confuse the target.

Strength.name: Strength
Strength.battle_effect: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.

Strength Sap.name: Strength Sap
Strength Sap.battle_effect: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It also lowers the target's Attack stat.
Strength Sap.secondary_effect: Heals user of Hit Points equal to target's Attack stat. Lowers target's Attack by 1 stage

String Shot.name: String Shot
String Shot.battle_effect: Opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user's mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.

Struggle.name: Struggle
Struggle.battle_effect: This attack is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also damages the user a little.
Struggle.secondary_effect: Damages user equal to 25% of maximum Hit Points

Struggle Bug.name: Struggle Bug
Struggle Bug.battle_effect: While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
Struggle Bug.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Stuff Cheeks.name: Stuff Cheeks
Stuff Cheeks.battle_effect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.

Stun Spore.name: Stun Spore
Stun Spore.battle_effect: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.

Submission.name: Submission
Submission.battle_effect: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.
Submission.secondary_effect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Wring Out.name: Wring Out
Wring Out.battle_effect: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.
Wring Out.secondary_effect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 110 making it a fairly powerful attack to be used. The means of determining the Base Power however is set based on the Opponent's Hit Points. The higher its hit points the better. This does not refer to the Base Stats for the Hit Points but rather the opponent's HP relative to its maximum at the current point in time.With this in mind, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attackBase Power = 110 * (Opponent's Current HP / Opponent's Max HP)So for example if we were battling a Max IV'd, Max EV'd Torterra at Level 100 and it had just over half its HP remaining, it would be as suchBase Power = 110 * (215 / 394) = 60.03 (2 d.p.)This shows that the best time to use Wring Out & Crush Grip would be at the start of a battle with any Pokémon, whether it has just been switched in or the battle is just beginning, in order to get the maximum Base Power. As the battle progresses, the power behind Wring Out & Crush Grip diminshes
